The ABA-ICC Project

Board of Advisors

The ABA-ICC Project is guided by its multinational and bipartisan Board of Advisors. The distinguished members of the Board are experts and leaders in their respective professional fields.

Michael S. Greco (Chair)

President of the American Bar Association (2005-06)
full bio
- Of Counsel, KL Gates LLC, Boston, Massachusetts, USA
- Visiting Professor, Peking University of Transnational Law, Shenzhen, China
- Chair of the ABA Center for Human Rights (2011-2013)

Professor M. Cherif Bassiouni

Professor Emeritus, DePaul University College of Law; Co-founder, International Institute of Higher Studies in Criminal Sciences
full bio
- Nominated for the Nobel Peace Prize for various roles played in the establishment of the International Criminal Court (1998)
- Held numerous UN positions integral in the establishment of the International Criminal Tribunal for the former Yugoslavia and the Convention on the Prevention and Suppression of Torture
- Most recently, he chaired the Bahrain Independent Commission of Inquiry and the UN Independent International Commission of Inquiry for Libya

Honorable Judge Thomas Buergenthal

Judge of the International Court of Justice (2000-10)
full bio
- Professor of Law, George Washington University
- Former Judge and President of the Inter-American Court of Human Rights (1979â€”91)
- Honorary President of the Inter-American Institute of Human Rights

Honorable Hans Corell

Under-Secretary-General for Legal Affairs and the Legal Counsel of the United Nations (1994-2004)
full bio
- Involved in the establishment of the International Criminal Tribunal for the former Yugoslavia and Rwanda, the Special Court for Sierra Leone, the Extraordinary Chambers in the Court of Cambodia, and the International Criminal Court- Ambassador and Head of the Legal Department of Swedenâ€™s Ministry for Foreign Affairs (1984â€”1994)- Served in Ministry of Justice of Sweden (1972â€”1984)- Appointment as a Judge of Appeal in Sweden (1980)

Professor David M. Crane

Professor of Law, Syracuse University; Chief Prosecutor of the Special Court for Sierra Leone
full bio
- Appointed to the Senior Executive Service of the U.S. (1997)
- Honorary Paramount Chief by the Civil Society Organizations of Sierra Leone
- Former Director of the Office of Intelligence Review

Donald Ferencz

Founder of the Global Institute for the Prevention of Aggression
full bio
- Visiting Professor, Middlesex University, London, England
- Co-founder with father Benjamin Ferencz of the Planethood Foundation that has a mission to condemn impunity for those suspected of participating in genocide, crimes against humanity, or war crimes
- Contributing author to the Handbook on the Ratification and Implementation of the Kampala Amendments to the Rome Statute of the International Criminal Court

Judge Richard J. Goldstone

Prosecutor of the International Criminal Tribunal for the former Yugoslavia and the International Criminal Tribunal for Rwanda (1994-96)
full bio
- Justice of the Constitutional Court of South Africa (1996-2003)
- Chairperson of the South African Standing Commission of Inquiry Regarding Public Violence and Intimidation (1991-1994)
- Member of the International Group of Advisers of the International Committee of the Red Cross

Ambassador Thomas Graham, Jr.

Director of the U.S. Arms Control and Disarmament Agency (1994-97)
full bio
- Senior US diplomat involved in the negotiation of every single international arms control and non-proliferation agreement from 1970 to 1997
- Executive Chairman of the Board at Lightbridge Corporation and the Board Chairman of CanAlaska Uranium Ltd. Amb.
- Instrumental in achieving US Senateâ€™s approval of the ratification of the Geneva Protocol banning the use of chemical and biological weapons in war

Honorable Philippe Kirsch

President of the International Criminal Court (2003-09)
full bio
- Chairman of the UN Diplomatic Conference of Plenipotentiaries on the Establishment of the International Criminal Court (1999-2002)
- Legal Advisor to the Department of Foreign Affairs and International Trade of Canada Ambassador and Deputy Representative to the UN (1988 â€“ 1992)
- Former Canadaian ambassador to the Kingdom of Sweden

Lieutenant Colonel William K. Lietzau

Deputy Assistant Secretary of Defense - Rule of Law and Detainee Policy (2010-13)
full bio
- Served in a variety of command and legal capacities including prosecutor, defense counsel, judge, and legal advisor at all levels of the US military
- Participated in negotiations of the Rome Statue that established the ICC
- Led the US delegation that helped draft the ICC Elements of Crimes

Honorable Judge Gabrielle Anne Kirk McDonald

President of the International Criminal Tribunal for the Former Yugoslavia (1997â€”1999).
full bio
- Only woman to occupy the ICTYâ€™s presidency position
- American arbitrator on the Iran â€“ U.S. Claims Tribunal in The Hague, The Netherlands (2001-2013)
- Judge at the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of Texas (1979-1988)

Professor Michael Newton

Professor of Practice, Vanderbilt University
full bio
- Senior advisor to the US Ambassador-at-Large for War Crimes Issues (1999 â€“ 2002)
- Assisted in drafting the Statute of the Iraqi High Tribunal (2006 â€“ 2007)
- Served as International Law Advisor to the Iraqi Judicial Chambers (2006 â€“ 2007)

Honorable Sandra Day O'Connor

Associate Justice of the U.S. Supreme Court (1981â€”2006)
full bio
- Judge on the Arizona Court of Appeals and of the Maricopa County Superior Court (1975 -1979)
- Assistant Attorney General of Arizona (1965 â€“ 1969)
- Deputy County Attorney of San Mateo County (1952 - 1953)

Ambassador David Scheffer

Professor, Northwestern Univ. School of Law; U.S. Ambassador at-Large for War Crimes Issues (1997-2001)
full bio
- US lead negotiator in the creation of the International Criminal Tribunals for the former Yugoslavia and Rwanda, the Special Court for Sierra Leone, the Extraordinary Chambers in Cambodia and the International Criminal Court
- UN Secretary-General's Special Expert on United Nations Assistance to the Khmer Rouge Trials

Honorable Thomas Siebert

U.S. Ambassador to Sweden (1994-98)
full bio
- Chairman of the International Telecommunications Union (ITU) Plenipotentiary Conference (1998)
- Member of the Council of American Ambassadors
- Board of the Diplomatic Council on Energy Security

William Taft IV

Chief Legal Adviser to the U.S. Department of State (2000-04)
full bio
- US Permanent Representative to NATO (1989 â€“ 1992)
- Deputy Secretary of Defense (1984 â€“ 1989)
- General Counsel for the Department of Defense (1981 â€“ 1984)

Honorable Judge Patricia Wald

Chief Judge for the U.S. Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia Circuit (1979â€“99)
full bio
- Member of the US Privacy and Civil Liberties Oversight Board
- Awarded the Presidential Medal of Freedom, the nation's highest civilian honor (2013)
